etymology.description: Pictogram: a flagpole with a drum (𠁩) set at the center; later explained as 丨 passing through 口 to mark the ‘center’; also interpreted as an arrow in a target.
etymology.interpretation: Earliest forms depict a central marker—pole and drum—used to gather people and signal direction, embodying the idea of a center point. The later abstraction of a vertical line piercing a square visually encodes “through the middle,” while the bullseye/arrow reading reinforces the notion of centrality and precision.

examples.chinese: 我住在中国的中部(我住在中國的中部)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Zhōngguó de zhōngbù.

examples.chinese: 我们在中间见面(我們在中間見面)。
她中文说得很好(她中文說得很好)。
examples.pinyin: Tā Zhōngwén shuō de hěn hǎo.
